original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Dukadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (6)
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma anuloma paccanīya
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions🔽The Numerical Series of the Conditions

original: 18.22. Mahantaraduka, Hetuduka🔽Sārammaṇaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasārammaṇo nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: mahantaraduka hetuduka  sa ārammaṇam hetum dhammam paṭicca na sa ārammaṇaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The Great Numerical Series🔽With a condition being a state with a root-cause, there arises a state without root-cause. (In brief.) With a root-cause, there are three; with object, one; … with none dissociated, three.

original: Sārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanārammaṇo nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sa ārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na anārammaṇaḥ na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a condition being a state without root-cause, there arises a state with a different object and a different root-cause.

original: Anārammaṇaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanārammaṇo nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Sārammaṇaṁ nahetuñca anārammaṇaṁ nahetuñca dhammaṁ paṭicca naanārammaṇo nanahetu
analyzed: anārammaṇam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na anārammaṇaḥ na na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā  sa ārammaṇam na hetum ca anārammaṇam na hetuñca dhammam paṭicca na anārammaṇaḥ na na hetu
translated: With a condition being a state without root-cause, there arises a state with a different object and a different root-cause.

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā
translated: With a condition being a state without root-cause and a state without root-cause, there arises a state with a different object and a different root-cause. (In brief.) With a root-cause, there are three; with object, three; with predominance,

original: ekaṁ …pe… purejāte āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: ekam pe purejāte āsevane ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: one; … with prenascence, with postnascence, one; … with none dissociated, three.

original: Nocittaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanocitto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Cittaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocitto nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Cetasikaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nacetasiko nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Cetasikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naacetasiko nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nacittasaṁsaṭṭho nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭham hetum dhammam paṭicca na citta sasaṭṭhaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is a root-cause and is associated with consciousness, a state that is not a root-cause and is not associated with consciousness arises with root-cause condition …

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: … with object condition … … with non-obstacle condition.

original: Cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasamuṭṭhāno nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānam hetum dhammam paṭicca no citta samuṭṭhānaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is a root-cause and is a product of consciousness, a state that is not a root-cause and is not a product of consciousness arises with root-cause condition …

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: … with object condition … … with non-obstacle condition.

original: Cittasahabhuṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasahabhū nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: citta sahabhum hetum dhammam paṭicca no citta sahabhū na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is a root-cause and is conascent with consciousness, a state that is not a root-cause and is not conascent with consciousness arises with root-cause condition …

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: … with object condition … … with non-obstacle condition.

original: Cittānuparivattiṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittānuparivattī nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: citta anuparivattim hetum dhammam paṭicca no citta anuparivattī na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: Dependent on a state that is a root-cause and is a concomitant of consciousness, a state that is not a root-cause and is not a concomitant of consciousness arises with root-cause condition …

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: … with object condition … … with non-obstacle condition.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhāno nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānam hetum dhammam paṭicca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhānaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Dependent on a state that is a root-cause and is a product of consciousness and is a concomitant of consciousness, a state that is not a root-cause and is not a product of consciousness and is not a concomitant of consciousness arises with root-cause condition …🔽… with object condition … … with non-obstacle condition.

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With root cause as condition, three … With an unobscured as condition, three.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhuṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānasahabhū nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhum hetum dhammam paṭicca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna sahabhū na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: With a phenomenon that is associated with mind and arisen together with mind as root cause as condition, there is a phenomenon that is not associated with mind and arisen together with mind, but is not root cause. (In brief.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With root cause as condition, three … With an unobscured as condition, three.

original: Cittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattiṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nocittasaṁsaṭṭhasamuṭṭhānānuparivattī nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Bāhiraṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabāhiro nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattim hetum dhammam paṭicca no citta sasaṭṭha samuṭṭhāna anuparivattī na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta  hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  bāhiram hetum dhammam paṭicca na bāhiraḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With a phenomenon that is associated with mind and arisen together with mind as root cause as condition, there is a phenomenon that is not associated with mind and is not arisen together with mind, but is not root cause. (In brief.)🔽With root cause as condition, three … With an unobscured as condition, three.🔽With an external as root cause as condition, there is an internal phenomenon that is not root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, three … With an unobscured as condition, three.

original: Ajjhattikaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naajjhattiko nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: ajjhattikam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na ajjhattikaḥ na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With an internal phenomenon that is not root cause as condition, there is an internal phenomenon that is not root cause. (In brief.) With root cause as condition, three … With an unobscured as condition, three.

original: Noupādā hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nanoupādā nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Upādā nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca noupādā nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… purejāte āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Upādinnaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naupādinno nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: no upādā hetum dhammam paṭicca na no upādā na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi  upādā na hetum dhammam paṭicca no upādā na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā ekam pe purejāte āsevane ekam pe avigate tīṇi  upādinnam hetum dhammam paṭicca na aupādinnaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With non-clinging conditions … (as in §1, but with the first and second terms reversed.)🔽With non-clinging conditions … (as in §2, but with the first and second terms reversed.)🔽With clung-to conditions … (as in §3, but with the first and second terms reversed.)

original: Anupādinnaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naupādinno nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā🔽… ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… āsevane🔽ekaṁ …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cattāri.
analyzed: anupādinnam hetum dhammam paṭicca na aupādinnaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā 🔽eka saṅkhitta hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā ekam pe āsevane 🔽ekam pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cattāri

original: Upādinnaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanupādinno nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.🔽Anupādinnaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naupādinno nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā

translated: With a non-attachment as condition, a non-attachment … (one) …

original: … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… āsevane ekaṁ
analyzed: eka saṅkhitta hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā ekam pe āsevane eka
translated: (In brief.) In the section on root-cause, there are two (sets of) two. In the section on object, there are two (sets of) two. In the section on predominance, there is one … In the section on nutriment, there is one …

original: …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: pe vipāke ekam pe avigate dve
translated: … In the section on result, there is one … In the section on non-distortion, there are two.
